description: Add critical/non-critical flag to task dependencies in plan.json schema
Modify check_dependencies() in orchestrate-agents to allow non-critical dependency failures
Update auto-cursor-planner to mark dependencies as critical/non-critical based on task analysis
Add retry tracking fields (retry_count, last_retry_time, next_retry_time) to tasks.json schema
Implement exponential backoff calculation function (base_delay * 2^retry_count, max 1 hour)
Add automatic retry logic to orchestrate-agents monitor that retries failed tasks with backoff
Enhance auto-cursor retry command to support automatic retry with configurable max retries
Enhance QA wrapper to classify issues as minor (formatting, docs) vs critical (tests, build errors)
Implement auto-fix logic for minor QA issues (formatting, missing docs, file structure)
Integrate auto-fix into run_qa_for_agent() to automatically fix minor issues before reporting
Enhance stuck agent detection in server.py to check process activity, log updates, and CPU usage
Implement recovery mechanism for stuck agents (restart, reset state, notify user)
Add configurable timeout thresholds for stuck detection (default: 10 min no log update, 30 min total)
Add WebSocket or Server-Sent Events (SSE) endpoint to server.py for real-time status updates
Update app.js to use WebSocket/SSE for real-time updates instead of polling
Create dependency graph visualization component using D3.js or vis.js showing task relationships
Add API endpoint to return task dependency graph data (nodes, edges, critical flags)
Integrate dependency graph visualization into kanban board view with interactive controls
